title: Can I write one paragraph for an essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can write anything you want, but you are unlikely to end up with a quality piece of writing. I think you are asking whether one paragraph equals an essay. Probably not. If you have a lengthy paragraph that makes a claim and supports it with sufficient evidence, you probably need to separate the information in the paragraph into several paragraphs according to the main points you make. If it is just a single paragraph, you likely have not written a thorough enough writing sample to fulfill the requirements of an essay.

No, you can not write one paragraph for an essay; that would be like calling a strawberry a smoothie. In proper writing, your statement of topic should be 3–5 sentences long, and is to be supported with at least 3 points of argument. Each argument should be 3–7 sentences. Lastly, you must conclude your argument by presenting your conclusion based on the arguments that you have presented. This should also be 3–5 sentences long. Each thing I mentioned is supposed to be separated by a blank double-space line or an indented line, implying a new paragraph. A paragraph is a unit of measurement, and it presents a slightly different but related topic to one’s discussion. An essay implies a minimum of 5 paragraphs. Any less is fundamentally not an essay, but a long response to a short-answer question.

One paragraph is not an essay, it is rather a brief answer to the question or it is a memo. An essay consists of, at least, 2–3 paragraphs (introduction+body+conclusion). Three requirements together make it almost impossible: cover the subject well, meet the length expectation, and make sure all grammatical requirements are met, including proper use of paragraphing.

There is no firm rule that says an essay needs to have a set number of paragraphs, but an essay must be a minimum of three paragraphs. There are a lot of people who say an essay should be five paragraphs, but it’s an extremely limiting rule, and unless you’ve been instructed to write a five paragraph essay, there’s no reason to stick to it. As a rule, you’ll write your essay in three main parts. First, you’ll introduce your topic to your reader. Next, you will have body text in which you discuss the topic in more detail, and finally, you’ll have a conclusion that tells your reader what you were able to see after looking into the facts or thinking through the topic.
